tn.text: Paul establishes that Christ is speaking through him and that Paul is wanting to restore them, encourage them, and unify them.

tn.ref: Every accusation must be established by the evidence of two or three witnesses
tn.text: This can be stated as active. AT: "Believe that someone has done something wrong only after two or three people have said the same thing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"all you other people"
This can be made active. AT: "they crucified him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: but we will live with him by the power of God
tn.text: God gives us the power and ability to live life in and with him.
The words "approved" and "unapproved" have to do with passing or not passing the "test."

tn.ref: Do you not realize that Jesus Christ is in you?
tn.text: Paul asks a question to emphasize his point. AT: "You should know that Jesus Christ is in you!" or "Jesus Christ is in you. You should know this already!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Possible meanings are 1) living inside each individual (UDB) or 2) "among you," part of and the most important member of the group.
This can be stated as a positive. AT: "we are certainly approved" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: that you may not do any wrong
tn.text: "that you will not sin at all" or "that you will not refuse to listen to us when we correct you." Paul is emphasizing the opposite with his statement. AT: "that you will do everything right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
"to be great teachers and live the truth"

tn.ref: we are not able to do anything against the truth
tn.text: "we are not able to keep people from learning the truth"

tn.ref: truth, but only for the truth
tn.text: "truth; everything we do will enable people to learn the truth"
"may become spiritually mature"

tn.ref: in the use of my authority
tn.text: "when I use my authority"

tn.ref: so that I may build you up, and not tear you down
tn.text: Paul speaks of helping the Corinthians to know Christ better as if he were constructing a building. AT: "to help you become better followers of Christ and not to discourage you so you stop following him." See how these words were translated in [[:en:bible:notes:1co:10:07|10:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Paul closes his letter to the Corinthian believers.
"Work toward maturity"
" live in harmony with one another"
"with Christian love"
"those whom God has set apart for himself" (UDB)
